course_title: Topics in History and Text: Uncovering Marginalized Voices
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 13Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as CL 285 2)


Explores ways of retrieving, extracting, and constructing the voices of marginalized people such as enslaved individuals, women, and the lower classes, especially in antiquity. Materials to examine include papyri, inscriptions, fables, graffiti, and dream literature.
course_description: The course demonstrates how literary, artistic, and/or cinematic texts, when understood in relation to the context of their production, can be used to study selected historical themes.
sections: Class Nbr: 3691, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: J. Liu, Status: Open
